awd_titl_txt: Conference: Network and Distributed System Security Symposium (NDSS) 2023
awd_abstract_narration:
This award supports student participation in the 2023 Network and Distributed System Security (NDSS) Symposium held in person in San Diego CA in February 2023. NDSS brings together innovative and forward-thinking members of the Internet community who research, design, develop, and deploy the technologies that define network and distributed system security. This grant enables career development and learning opportunities for US-based and/or US citizen graduate students. Attending conferences is an important component of graduate school education for our society's future computer security researchers. Students have the opportunity to discuss leading edge research with world-class computer security researchers, and establish networks, connections, and mentoring relationships that will serve them well during their research careers.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
The Internet Society has been the organizational home of the Network and Distributed Systems Security (NDSS) Symposium for over 30 years. NDSS is a highly-ranked computer security conference, with 8 co-located events, and three tracks of peer-reviewed research papers over a week.

The NDSS Symposium 2023 took place from 27 February to 3 March 2023 in San Diego, California. Attendees included university researchers and educators, students, chief technology and privacy officers, security analysts, system administrators, operations, and security managers.

With this grant, the Internet Society was able to award financial assistance to 17 graduate students, including waiving event registration fees ($550 per person) and providing travel grants of $700 – $1,500, totaling $27,250.

In addition to the Internet Society's funding and resourcing, NDSS 2023 attracted $107,000 in sponsorship from organizations in information technology industries, including cybersecurity, manufacturers, and online service providers; automotive and telecommunication sectors; and academia and federal government support (this grant from NSF).

The additional funding was used to make sure non-US students could also receive support like the NSF funding provided for US students. The Internet Society values the ongoing support and financial contributions from the National Science Foundation to ensure this vital conference continues year after year.


Last Modified: 02/28/2024
Modified by: Joseph L Hall
